alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 03 at 3:05AM AKST until February 04 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow with low visibility and wind chills to 55 below expected. Plan on areas of poor visibilities to create difficult travel conditions at times. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...On Elliott Highway summits. * WHEN...Until midnight Thursday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds gusting to 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Large snow drifts will form. Cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
